definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)

sentences.english: You're mad because he lied to you.
sentences.chinese: 你因为他对你撒了个谎就气得不顾一切了。

sentences.english: Ink to write that, should hide the facts written in blood.
sentences.chinese: 墨写的谎说，决掩不住血写的事实。

sentences.english: John had a sneaking suspicion that his wife was lying about how the car had gotten scratched.
sentences.chinese: 约翰暗中怀疑他妻子对于汽车是怎么擦破的说了谎。

sentences.english: A lie ages of bullying through the multitudinous mind three words.
sentences.chinese: 一句谎世世欺三句言透沵心。

sentences.english: Mrs King could not stay in the company because she had lied in order to get a job.
sentences.chinese: 金女士不能留在公司里，因为为了找工作她说了谎。

sentences.english: Local authorities are now looking into perjury charges against pro-ID board members who apparently lied in depositions and on the witness stand.
sentences.chinese: 显然这些理事会成员在宣示作证时和证人席上撒了谎。

sentences.english: Those that think it permissible to tell white lies soon grow color blind.
sentences.chinese: 认为说白谎无所谓的人很快就会变成色盲。

sentences.english: It shames me to say it, but I told a lie when questioned at the meeting by my boss.
sentences.chinese: 说来不好意思，在会上被老板质问时我撒了谎。

sentences.english: Farmers to cloth, ask what call in central, cloth cloth lied to agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 农给布打电话，问布在什么中央，布向农撒了谎。

sentences.english: Only a fifth of two-year-olds tested in the study were able to lie.
sentences.chinese: 只需五合之一的两岁儿童能够道谎。

sentences.english: I have lied in admitting the disgusting charges laid against my Order.
sentences.chinese: 我再那些对我的信仰邻人作呕的指控上撒了谎。

sentences.english: I would rather lose a dozen cherry trees than you should tell one lie.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿失掉一打樱桃树而不愿听到你撒一次谎。

sentences.english: After all your lies, I could not believe in you.
sentences.chinese: 你跟我撒了这么多次谎，我无法再相信你了。

sentences.english: They had to tell such lies because truth-tellers could not survive.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须说这样的谎因为讲真话的人无法生存。

definition: to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
(to express one's) true feelings/what is on one's mind/secret mind
to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
